identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

abstract.p: New Jersey Nets free agent notes (S)

block.p: The Nets remain in talking mode a day after meeting with 6-9 forward Aaron Williams, a free agent who played last season with the Washington Wizards. The 29-year-old Williams, who has played with six N.B.A. teams in six years, met with the Knicks Tuesday afternoon, then crossed the Hudson to meet with Nets' officials. Williams averaged 5 rebounds and a career-high 7.6 points per game last season in 19.1 minutes a game.

The Nets remain in talking mode a day after meeting with 6-9 forward Aaron Williams, a free agent who played last season with the Washington Wizards. The 29-year-old Williams, who has played with six N.B.A. teams in six years, met with the Knicks Tuesday afternoon, then crossed the Hudson to meet with Nets' officials. Williams averaged 5 rebounds and a career-high 7.6 points per game last season in 19.1 minutes a game.
''It was a feeling-out process. We haven't had any negotiations,'' the Nets' president, Rod Thorn, said. ''We're among the teams that have some interest in him.''
